revised_title: Anatomy and Development of the Liver in Various Species
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of the liver in various animals, including the Earthworm, Leech, and Sandworm. They describe the liver's function and its role in the gastrointestinal system, as well as the differences in its structure and function across different species. The author also discusses the role of bile and its secretion in the liver and its connection to the digestive process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
